alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 01 at 4:29PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect northern Washington and eastern Penobscot Counties... At 429 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was 7 miles south of Topsfield, or 19 miles southwest of Vanceboro...moving east AT 40 MPH. Locations impacted include... Calais, Danforth, Vanceboro, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Topsfield, Meddybemps, Grand Lake Stream, Fowler Township, Dyer Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, Robbinston, Alexander, Charlotte, Baring, Carroll, Waite and Codyville. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Calais and Brookton. State Highway 9 between Alexander and Calais. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington
